file_content.text: Thanks again for your work. We're debriefing the prisoners now.
We picked up comm chatter from the freed prisoners. So the Advozsec were pirates after all--huh.
You did good work, but why let the Republic prisoners go when you could have killed them?
When I activated the controls, all the cages opened.
It was an accident.
Really? That's a shame. But at least you succeeded in rescuing our people.
We are citizens of the Empire, Captain. We have a system of honor. We do not kill unarmed soldiers.
I do not kill helpless men.
Of... of course. My apologies, my lord.
If you want me to kill unarmed men, you better pay me first.
Killing them wasn't my job.
I see. Well, it's too late, now.
I thought it best to keep them alive. We may get some intel out of them.
Killing is wasteful.
Good thinking. I'll get my men on it.
That's not your concern.
Yes. Point taken.
Good work with the POWs. But what happened? My soldiers said something about the Republic soldiers and Advozsec fighting.
The Advozsec weren't guards--they were pirates.
The Advozsec took over.
Ah. Things are starting to make sense now.
I have my ways.
Understood.
Your prisoners are free, and the Advozsec are dead. That should be sufficient.
Forget it.
Yes, of course.
My orders are to ship the prisoners to Hoth Command for debriefing. I'll be sure to report your aid.
You should hurry. No telling what those Advozsec will do to the prisoners if they get bored.
Uh... my lord. I know I told Command it was urgent, but I didn't think they'd send a Sith. I'm honored.
A bounty hunter? I guess Command agreed with my analysis after all.
A special operative? Command really did take my assessment seriously.
Seems Hoth Command took my request for help seriously after all.
I'm Captain Jerrod. For weeks now we've been here, listening in on Republic transmissions. I was ready to pack it in when we finally struck it lucky.
The Republic is holding Imperial soldiers in a makeshift POW camp nearby.
You know the target. Shouldn't you be doing something?
Why haven't you rescued them?
We tried, but we were caught off guard.
How many men are guarding the prisoners?
What are the enemy's numbers?
No men. That's the strange thing.
This isn't my job.
My apologies. I thought you were my reinforcements, but maybe that's for the best. It's skills like yours that we really need.
The camp is guarded by Advozsec. Aliens. Frankly, I'm not sure what they're doing there.
We weren't expecting them--and half my men were taken before we could retreat.
You should have fought to the death.
Only cowards retreat.
A leader should be prepared for every eventuality.
You failed your men.
You can't be very popular right now.
I'm glad I'm not you.
That's hardly fair. We were taken by surprise! Anyway, that's why I asked for help.
Let me guess. You want me to wipe out all the Advozsec and save the day.
So you need my help?
I wouldn't put it exactly like that.
Why is this my problem?
I was hoping you could infiltrate the base and take out the Advozsec so we can rescue our prisoners.
I can't send my men in again. The Advozsec outnumber us two to one. This calls for someone with more direct field experience than me.
I'll do it.
I suppose I can look into it.
The POWs are in a cave not far from here. Be careful--the Advozsec will leave you bleeding in the snow as soon as take you prisoner.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
Really? I'm sorry to hear that. Then I won't keep you any longer.
Sorry--I can't talk now. I'm about to lead a raid against Republic troops.
Imperial Command sent you? I guess they took my assessment seriously after all.
